1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Text enclosed in angle brackets.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol.AngleText
6  ( -- * Functions
7    angleQuote,
8    angleTexts,
9    -- * Keyword table
10    -- $Table
11  ) where
12
13import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture     as O
14
15-- | Convert string into double-quoted and angle-quoted form.
16--
17--   >>> putStrLn $ angleQuote "aaa"
18--   "aaa"
19--
20--   >>> putStrLn $ angleQuote "\t"
21--   <tab>
22--
23--   >>> putStrLn $ angleQuote "aaa\nbbb\r\nccc\r\n\r\nddd"
24--   "aaa" <lf> "bbb" <crlf> "ccc" <crlf> <crlf> "ddd"
25--
26angleQuote :: O.StringMap
27angleQuote = openLoop where
28    openLoop = open . loop
29
30    loop (c : cs) = case angleSplit c cs of
31                      Nothing       -> c : loop cs
32                      Just (w, cs2) -> "\" " ++ w ++
33                                       O.addSpace (openLoop cs2)
34    loop "" = "\""
35
36    open ('"' : cs)  = O.trimBegin cs   -- omit closing double quote
37    open cs          = '"' : cs         -- append opening double quote
38
39-- | Split angle keyword.
40--
41--   >>> let (c : cs) = "abc" in angleSplit c cs
42--   Nothing
43--
44--   >>> let (c : cs) =  "\nabc" in angleSplit c cs
45--   Just ("<lf>", "abc")
46--
47--   >>> let (c : cs) =  "\0abc" in angleSplit c cs
48--   Just ("<c0>", "abc")
49--
50angleSplit :: Char -> String -> Maybe (String, String)
51angleSplit c cs =
52    case O.majorGeneralCategory c of
53      O.UnicodePunctuation -> punct c
54      O.UnicodeOther       -> other c
55      _                    -> Nothing
56    where
57      just w               = Just (w, cs)
58      just2 w cs2          = Just (w, cs2)
59
60      punct '"'            = just "<qq>"
61      punct _              = Nothing
62
63      other '\r'           = cr cs
64      other '\n'           = just "<lf>"
65      other '\t'           = just "<tab>"
66      other _              = just (angleChar c)
67
68      cr ('\n' : cs2)      = just2 "<crlf>" cs2
69      cr _                 = just "<cr>"
70
71-- | Angle text of the Unicode code point.
72--
73--   >>> angleChar 'K'
74--   "<U+4B>"
75--
76angleChar :: Char -> String
77angleChar c = "<U+" ++ O.intUpperHexString (fromEnum c) ++ ">"
78
79-- | Table of coresspondences of angle text and its replacement.
80--
81--   >>> lookup "lf" angleTexts
82--   Just "\n"
83--
84angleTexts :: [(String, String)]
85angleTexts =
86    --  NAME         REPLACEMENT
87    [ o "cr"         "\r"
88    , o "crlf"       "\r\n"
89    , o "lf"         "\n"
90    , o "q"          "'"
91    , o "qq"         "\""
92    , o "sp"         " "
93    , o "tab"        "\t"
94    , o "dot"        "."
95    , o "comma"      ","
96    , o "colon"      ":"
97    , o "semicolon"  ";"
98    ] where o = (,)
99
100-- $Table
101--
102--  Some text literals are written
103--  using the following angle text.
104--
105--  [@\<cr\>@]      Carriage return
106--
107--  [@\<crlf\>@]    Carriage return and line feed
108--
109--  [@\<lf\>@]      Line feed
110--
111--  [@\<q\>@]       Single quote (@'@)
112--
113--  [@\<qq\>@]      Double quote (@\"@)
114--
115--  [@\<sp\>@]      Space
116--
117--  [@\<tab\>@]     Tab
118--
119
